oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different customs concerning the eating of the Porcupine. (L VII.
6594 rev.). Certain persons not allowed to eat the tail of the Porcupine (L VIII.
7409, 7408 rev. and 7409 rev.). A part of the Porcupine is used to prevent the evil consequences of eating !k . (L VIII.
16. 7450 rev., note). Only old people and married women with their own huts can eat the tail safely.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A girl does not eat porcupines' tails
